intro: Ruschia cradockensis, commonly known as the Cradock Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent species is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
